commit_message:
Update help message for datasource CLI

This commit is to update the help messages to support datasource
related data can be queried using both datasource name or ID

Change-Id: I93eb5063f02cf114715ba876b081f32818872187
Closes-Bug:#1552212

commit_message:
XenAPI: introduce unit test for XenAPI plugins

This is the first patch set to introduce unit test for XenAPI
plugins. It contains the common part depended by other plugin
tests. In order to make this first patch set to be as simple
as possible, it only covers the test framework and the unit
test for a simple plugin.

Change-Id: Iece439661cc4337e826d0eb15b438d2716214fb5

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from nova import test from nova.tests.unit.virt.xenapi import plugins pluginlib = plugins.load_plugin("pluginlib_nova.py") class pluginlibNovaTestCase(test.NoDBTestCase): def test_exists_key_exists(self): key = 'fake_key' args = {key: 'fake_value'} return_value = pluginlib.exists(args, key) expected = 'fake_value' self.assertEqual(expected, return_value) def test_exists_key_not_exist(self): key = 'fake_key' args = {'other_key': 'other_value'} self.assertRaises(pluginlib.ArgumentError, pluginlib.exists, args, key)

commit_message:
Fix the TTL issue of subscriptions for MongoDB

Currently, the TTL of subscriptons doesn't work. That said, after
the ttl seconds, the subscription can't be deleted. This patch
also adds a default TTL for subscription. This patch fixes the bug
and a functional test will be added in Zaqar client.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Partial-Bug: #1529168

Change-Id: I18e6dd3833f11692775b1285365afbced5725249
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/64/270464/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(flwang): If TTL is None then we will take it as a permanent # subscription. That said the subscription won't be removed # automatically unless user delete it manually. if ttl and isinstance(ttl, int): ttl = int(ttl) expires = now + ttl else: expires = None

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-02 12:17:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/73db0cfe7ea6fb2a4327d73b386a76abf0b61d71', 'message': 'Use current, but pinned versions of pip, setuptools and wheel

This patch provides a convenience script to check for the current
version of any package on PyPI, then output it in various ways.

This script is used in the SHA updating script in order to provide
a current set of critical packages to ensure that each SHA bump
includes an update to a current version of pip, setuptools and
wheel but also to ensure that they are pinned to a specific version
with this particular set of packages.

This ensures that we keep current with these packages as they
change, but also ensures that the versions tested for each tag are

commit_message:
Use current, but pinned versions of pip, setuptools and wheel

This patch provides a convenience script to check for the current
version of any package on PyPI, then output it in various ways.

This script is used in the SHA updating script in order to provide
a current set of critical packages to ensure that each SHA bump
includes an update to a current version of pip, setuptools and
wheel but also to ensure that they are pinned to a specific version
with this particular set of packages.

This ensures that we keep current with these packages as they
change, but also ensures that the versions tested for each tag are
the versions used forever.

The patch also ensures that any package installed by pip is upgraded
to the expected versions.

This is a combined backport of:
 - https://review.openstack.org/284701
 - https://review.openstack.org/284977
 - https://review.openstack.org/287700
 - https://review.openstack.org/287739

Change-Id: I61795b3afb4804060d494a08975c10adcf52f468

added_lines: # These are pinned to ensure exactly the same behaviour forever! # These pins are updated through the sources-branch-updater script pip_packages: - pip==8.0.3 - setuptools==20.1.1 - wheel==0.29.0

commit_message:
Fix for uppercase algo support with KMIP backend

Clients can pass algorithm in different case as part of order create
request. Barbican is able to handle that for db backend but not for
kmip backend. So fix is to address that.

Added unit test and smoke functional test for coverage.

Change-Id: Ia42cdfc17e71d2cccb567739ae766b555879a153
Closes-Bug: #1547270

commit_message:
Add tox support for check/gate

This charm was missed pre-migration to git/gerrit.

Add support for executing pep8 and unit tests using tox.

Change-Id: I5518e870c572ccc292d6fe4e9b7c910c7f3f0260
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-percona-cluster refs/changes/82/287082/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [tox] envlist = pep8,py27 skipsdist = True [testenv] setenv = VIRTUAL_ENV={envdir} PYTHONHASHSEED=0 install_command = pip install --allow-unverified python-apt {opts} {packages} commands = ostestr {posargs} sitepackages = True [testenv:py27] basepython = python2.7 deps = -r{toxinidir}/requirements.txt -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt [testenv:pep8] basepython = python2.7 deps = -r{toxinidir}/requirements.txt -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt commands = flake8 {posargs} hooks unit_tests tests charm proof [testenv:venv] commands = {posargs} [flake8] ignore = E402,E226 exclude = hooks/charmhelpers,tests/charmhelpers

commit_message:
Added property to associate environment with OS region

The Environment class got two additional properties:

region - name of the region where environment should be deployed. If
null then home region is used.

regionConfigs - config property (taken from class config) that specifies
region parameters. It is a dictionary of a form regionName -> regionSettings.
Currently the only setting available is a agentRabbitMq that is itself
a dictionary containing the same options as [rabbitmq] section of murano.conf

Thus the configuration file io.murano.Environment.yaml may look like:

 regionConfigs:
   RegionOne:
     agentRabbitMq:
       host: rabbitMqHostName
       port: 5672
       login: murano
       password: murano
       virtual_host: /
       ssl: false
       ca_certs: null

Implements Blueprint: assign-environment-to-region
Change-Id: I3c84c96f8eeae738f83ed7b3691be38100b30e1d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/40/277240/21 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - $environment: $.find(std:Environment).require() - $._netExplorer: new(sys:NetworkExplorer, $environment)

commit_message:
Fix test order and region in guest_log scenario

The test_log_generator_swift_client_sys test needs to run after a
specific test (test_log_generator_publish_sys) when running int-tests
with TESTS_DO_NOT_DELETE_INSTANCE set.  This is due to the fact that
the logs are not otherwise left in a known state and running
subsequent tests with TESTS_USE_INSTANCE_ID will cause failures.

The swift client created by the tests should also pass in the
proper region code from the test file, not from the environment

Change-Id: Ib21cb9483cc26d311313361d9ccd6d748d5fa0fb
Depends-On: I19155463505500d1ca9a22ee9a58c80ff0c23ac2
Depends-On: I77981d282a6504379bb75a1e56cfb410e1c54f9a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/84/283284/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test(depends_on=[test_log_publish_sys], runs_after=[test_log_generator_publish_sys])

commit_message:
Fix for guest_log authentication failure

Now passing in the tenant_name as part of the os_options
and getting all the options from the Trove client instead
of the environment.

Change-Id: I19155463505500d1ca9a22ee9a58c80ff0c23ac2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-troveclient refs/changes/83/283283/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from swiftclient import client as swift_client def _get_swift_client(self): my_var = self.api.client from pprint import pprint print("Var: %s" % my_var) pprint(vars(my_var)) if hasattr(self.api.client, 'auth'): auth_url = self.api.client.auth.auth_url user = self.api.client.auth._username key = self.api.client.auth._password tenant_name = self.api.client.auth._project_name else: auth_url = self.api.client.auth_url user = self.api.client.username key = self.api.client.password tenant_name = self.api.client.tenant # remove '/tokens' from the end of auth_url so it works for swift auth_url = auth_url.replace("/tokens$", "") region_name = self.api.client.region_name os_options = {'tenant_name': tenant_name, 'region_name': region_name} print("auth_url: %s user: %s pwd: %s os_options: %s" % (auth_url, user, key, os_options)) return swift_client.Connection( auth_url, user, key, auth_version="2.0", os_options=os_options) except swift_client.ClientException as ex: swift = self._get_swift_client() except swift_client.ClientException as ex:
deleted_lines: import os from swiftclient import clientdef swift_client(): auth_url = os.getenv("OS_AUTH_URL") user = os.getenv("OS_USERNAME") key = os.getenv("OS_PASSWORD") tenant = os.getenv("OS_TENANT_NAME") os_options = {'region_name': os.getenv("OS_REGION_NAME")} return client.Connection(auth_url, user, key, tenant_name=tenant, auth_version="2.0", os_options=os_options) log_cache = {} except client.ClientException as ex: swift = swift_client() except client.ClientException as ex:

commit_message:
Set testenv env for api and scenario testing

This patch implements to perform local testing for api and
scenario tests.

Change-Id: I164c51e0e1a86f782e7669e0483c78743e992a42
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/12/278812/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:api] sitepackages=True setenv = OS_TEST_PATH=./neutron_fwaas/tests/tempest_plugin/tests/api/ OS_TESTR_CONCURRENCY=1 TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR={env:TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR:/opt/stack/tempest/etc} commands = python setup.py testr --slowest --testr-args='{posargs}' [testenv:scenario] sitepackages=True setenv = OS_TEST_PATH=./neutron_fwaas/tests/tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/ OS_TESTR_CONCURRENCY=1 TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR={env:TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR:/opt/stack/tempest/etc} commands = python setup.py testr --slowest --testr-args='{posargs}'

Updating information in the IPA documentation for diskimage-builder usage.

added_lines: One way to build a ramdisk image for IPA is with the CoreOS image [1]_.Another way to build a ramdisk image for IPA is by using disk-image-builder [3]_. The ironic-agent diskimage-builder element builds the IPA ramdisk, which installs all the required packages and configures services as needed.
deleted_lines: The only current supported ramdisk image for IPA is the CoreOS image [1]_.There is currently no production-ready ironic-python-agent ramdisk images using disk-image-builder, but one is currently under development [3]_.

commit_message:
refactor: Drop unsupported configurations and code

Includes dropping support for quantum, nvp plugin (renamed
nsx long ago) and generally refactoring the unit tests
around no longer having to deal with neutron and quantum in
the same codebase.

Drop support for database connections - these are no longer
required as all DB access is now via RPC to nova-conductor
or neutron-server.

Roll-up configuration file templates < icehouse, remove any
that are no longer required.

Refactor basic_deployment a bit as it was using the shared-db
relation to retrieve the n-gateway units private-address.

Change-Id: I22957c0e21c4dd49e5aa74795173b4fc8f043f55
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-gateway refs/changes/51/286451/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: [DEFAULT] verbose = {{ verbose }} debug = {{ debug }} use_syslog = {{ use_syslog }} lock_path = /var/lock/quantum core_plugin = {{ core_plugin }} rabbit_userid = {{ rabbitmq_user }} rabbit_virtual_host = {{ rabbitmq_virtual_host }} rabbit_host = {{ rabbitmq_host }} rabbit_password = {{ rabbitmq_password }} control_exchange = quantum notification_driver = quantum.openstack.common.notifier.list_notifier list_notifier_drivers = quantum.openstack.common.notifier.rabbit_notifier [AGENT] root_helper = sudo /usr/bin/quantum-rootwrap /etc/quantum/rootwrap.conf

'}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2015-12-18 01:11:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/3a78bda9019059b026851fd12fc622e343d06403', 'message': "Horizon Checkboxes are now themeable.

Horizon checkboxes were using a standard checkbox. Unfortunately,
this type of checkbox is only customizable through Chrome, and
even then, its not completely flexible.

The default checkboxes have now been altered to allow for a highly
customized experience through the use of CSS pseudo elements and
Icon Fonts. This allows the color, size and unselected and selected
states of the checkbox to be altered.

The 'default' theme uses the standard Font Awesome checked and
unchecked icons.  The 'material' now uses the Material Design
checkbox design.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg

Change-Id: I52602357d831a5e978fe6916b37b0cde9edb2b9b

commit_message:
Horizon Checkboxes are now themeable.

Horizon checkboxes were using a standard checkbox. Unfortunately,
this type of checkbox is only customizable through Chrome, and
even then, its not completely flexible.

The default checkboxes have now been altered to allow for a highly
customized experience through the use of CSS pseudo elements and
Icon Fonts. This allows the color, size and unselected and selected
states of the checkbox to be customized.

The 'default' theme uses the standard Font Awesome checked and
unchecked icons.  The 'material' now uses the Material Design
checkbox design.

It was also noticed (and fixed) that the help-icon on the forms
were not the same color as its corresponding text.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg

Change-Id: I52602357d831a5e978fe6916b37b0cde9edb2b9b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/61/252161/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: // // Custom Material Checkboxes // -------------------------------------------------- @import "/horizon/lib/mdi/scss/icons"; .fancy-checkbox { // Hide the real checkbox input[type=checkbox] { // The checkbox - Unchecked & + label { @extend .mdi-checkbox-blank-outline; &:before { @extend .mdi; font-size: $font-size-h5; } } // The checkbox - Checked &:checked + label { @extend .mdi-checkbox-marked; color: $brand-primary; } } }

commit_message:
Libvirt: correct libvirt reference url link when live-migration failed

_compare_cpu gives a libvirt url link for the compare result, which is an
outdate url, this patch just corrects it.

Closes-bug: 1433843
Change-Id: Ib9666f8155240800cbd909a3cea1d4f08bfcbf34

commit_message:
Add blueprint spec manage-ceilometer-alarms

Change-Id: I312fe2ba2602863150d4da4048ae9fda00696a71
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage-specs refs/changes/49/244049/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================== Raise/Delete Ceilometer Alarms ============================== https://TODO The Evaluator performs root cause analysis on the Vitrage Graph and may determine that an alarm should be created, deleted or otherwise updated. Other components are notified of such changes by the Vitrage Notifier service. Among others, Vitrage Notifier is responsible for handling Ceilometer Alarms. :: +------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+ | Ceilometer <--+ | | | | +------------------+ | Update | Vitrage | Raise | Vitrage | +--------| <----------| | +------------------+ | Alarm | Notifier | Alarm | Evaluator | | Other components <--+ | | | | +------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+ Problem description =================== Vitrage should be capable of creating, deleting and otherwise updating alarms as requested by the Evaluator Engine. The notifier is responsible for ensuring these updates are executed. Specifically we will start here with Ceilometer alarms. Proposed change =============== 1. The Vitrage Notifier will be separate from the Evaluator, as the two will have different demands of scale and other performance considerations. 2. The Vitrage Notifier will supply an API used by the Vitrage Evaluator, containing the following functionality: - Create alert - Delete alert - Update alert 3. The Notifier will call the relevant Ceilometer API to preform the required action. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Pipeline impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance/Scalability Impacts ------------------------------- None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: None. Work Items ---------- - Create Notifier API - Add support for Ceilometer alarm managment - Tempest tests as specified below Future lifecycle ================ None Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= - This change needs to be tested by unit tests. - Tempest tests should be added to make sure the integrity of the full cycle Documentation Impact ==================== References ==========

added_lines: new_prop = self._merge_properties(orig_prop, v.properties, hard_update) self._g.add_node(n=v.vertex_id, attr_dict=new_prop) new_prop = self._merge_properties(orig_prop, e.properties, hard_update) self._g.add_edge(e.source_id, e.target_id, e.label, new_prop) def _merge_properties(orig_props, new_props, hard_update): if orig_props is None or hard_update: result = dict() else: result = orig_props result.update(new_props) # Remove fields with None value del result[key] return result
deleted_lines: if orig_prop and hard_update: orig_prop.clear() v.properties = self._update_properties(orig_prop, v.properties) self._add_vertex(v) if orig_prop and hard_update: orig_prop.clear() e.properties = self._update_properties(orig_prop, e.properties) self._add_edge(e) def _update_properties(orig_props, new_props): if orig_props is None: orig_props = dict() del new_props[key] if key in orig_props: del orig_props[key] orig_props.update(new_props) return orig_props

commit_message:
Add SSL support for freezer

This commit enable to send the certificate to support
secure connections for freezer

Implements bp: ssl-support

Change-Id: I821ac837508351d9d84897c4c9a6ee651944dd32

commit_message:
Bump to latest ansible and deps

Ansible is pinned to single commit in devel branch to pull in the
latest shade module we need (domain control). It will be available in
ansible 2.1

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I4c21fa1d2cec30d4aeb80e050ef4a62332f9ed45

subject: Refactor Hitachi Block Storage Driver (patch - 4/4)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-16 05:43:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/e0cd454fb9be3b6aaf7195eff010b763f9e73380', 'message': 'Refactor Hitachi Block Storage Driver (Fourth patch)

Our drivers have already supported FC and iSCSI protocols.
Our drivers have two storage interfaces, named HORCM and SNM2.
Our drivers have already supported three kinds of drivers on our code,
HORCMFC, SNM2FC and SNM2ISCSI.

I found that it is hard to maintain the present code. So I refactor our
code drastically.

I submit following four patches:
(1) refactor base libraries. And delete the existing test driver to not
    break the existing unit tests.
(2) refactor SNM2FC drivers based on libraries change.
(3) refactor SNM2ISCSI drivers based on libraries change.
(4) refactor HORCMFC drivers based on libraries change.

This patch is last one.

The class relationship of my patches are following:
1. The most upper classes are HBSDFC. These classes inherit
   VolumeDriver class. These classes have HBSDCOMMON.
2. HBSDCOMMON class has common methods with HORCM and SNM2.
3. HBSDHORCM and HBSDSNM2 classes inherit HBSDCOMMON.
   HBSDHORCM class has the characteristic methods for HORCM interface.
   HBSDSNM2 class has the characteristic methods for SNM2 interface.
4. HBSDHORCMFC class inherit HBSDHORCM.
   HBSDHORCMFC class has the characteristic interfaces for HORCM and FC
5. HBSDSNM2FC and HBSDSNM2ISCSI classes inherit HBSDSNM2.
   These classes have characteristic interfaces respectively.

Change-Id: I34ee7a0548153d8a9de46c21f5cdea901198a6d5
Implements: blueprint refactoring-hbsd-driver
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-16 17:17:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/3d426590790b35271e4d3adbfbc013f4810fa64e', 'message': 'Refactor Hitachi Block Storage Driver (patch - 4/4)

Refactor Hitachi Block Storage Driver (patch - 4/4)

This patch is for refactoring HORCMFC drivers.

Implements: blueprint refactoring-hbsd-driver

subject: [Murano Docs] Fix description for bundle-import
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-03 14:16:48.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/articles/client.rst', 'doc/source/draft/enduser-guide/use_cli.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/5c40afe497c3f3500c507445013b3e7e0c3497f6', 'message': '[Murano Docs] Fix description for bundle-import

We cannot specify category for bundle. This patch removes
this information
Change-Id: I90b3f7755fdcca5344df8309402d9de37de65142
'}]
commit_message:
[Murano Docs] Fix description for bundle-import

We cannot specify category for bundle. This patch removes
this information
Change-Id: I90b3f7755fdcca5344df8309402d9de37de65142
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/18/287818/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: When importing bundles, you can set their publicity with ``--is-public``.
deleted_lines: When importing bundles, you can specify their categories with ``-c/--categories`` and set their publicity with ``--is-public``.

subject: Extension methods were introduced to MuranoPL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-02 18:23:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/d5413c48e1c126ea4d1a02634d1652b57f29428f', 'message': '[WiP] extension methods

Change-Id: If757327857376ac66784acd4bd29471e6f28b612
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-02 22:15:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/bb09085a9cc8ead33fea90235821a988710a2cd6', 'message': 'Extension methods were introduced to MuranoPL

* New method type: extension methods. Extension methods enable you
   to "add" methods to existing types without modifying the original type.

   Extension methods are a special kind of static method, but they are
   called as if they were instance methods on the extended type.

   Extension methods are identified by "Usage: Extension" and the
   type they extend is determined by their first argument contract.
   Thus such methods must have at lease one parameter.

* New type-level keyword "Import" which can be either list or
   scalar that specifies type names which extensions methods
   should be imported into class context and thus become available
   to type members.

Change-Id: If757327857376ac66784acd4bd29471e6f28b612
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-02 22:21:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/2db0d6ee6ae803d539e9a435def7307368a153f3', 'message': 'Extension methods were introduced to MuranoPL

   type they extend is determined by their first argument contract.
   Thus such methods must have at lease one parameter.

* New type-level keyword "Import" which can be either list or
   scalar that specifies type names which extensions methods
   should be imported into class context and thus become available
   to type members.

Change-Id: If757327857376ac66784acd4bd29471e6f28b612

Change-Id: If757327857376ac66784acd4bd29471e6f28b612
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-03 13:05:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/b6f75d22495f49c9e1233651b7b7e6e055d57c7f', 'message': 'Extension methods were introduced to MuranoPL

* New method type: extension methods. Extension methods enable you
   to "add" methods to existing types without modifying the original type.

   Extension methods are a special kind of static method, but they are
   called as if they were instance methods on the extended type.

   Extension methods are identified by "Usage: Extension" and the
   type they extend is determined by their first argument contract.
   Thus such methods must have at lease one parameter.

* New type-level keyword "Import" which can be either list or
   scalar that specifies type names which extensions methods
   should be imported into class context and thus become available

* New method type: extension methods. Extension methods enable you
   to "add" methods to existing types without modifying the original type.

   Extension methods are a special kind of static method, but they are
   called as if they were instance methods on the extended type.

   Extension methods are identified by "Usage: Extension" and the
   type they extend is determined by their first argument contract.

   to type members.

commit_message:
Extension methods were introduced to MuranoPL

* New method type: extension methods. Extension methods enable you
   to "add" methods to existing types without modifying the original type.

   Extension methods are a special kind of static method, but they are
   called as if they were instance methods on the extended type.

   Extension methods are identified by "Usage: Extension" and the
   type they extend is determined by their first argument contract.
   Thus such methods must have at lease one parameter.

* New type-level keyword "Import" which can be either list or
   scalar that specifies type names which extensions methods
   should be imported into class context and thus become available
   to type members.

Change-Id: If757327857376ac66784acd4bd29471e6f28b612

subject: loadbalancer: fix Redis timeout HAproxy config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-25 15:47:39.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/loadbalancer.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/6e4870915281c80176ea08584f337099e60e2b2d', 'message': "loadbalancer: fix Redis timeout HAproxy config

Current HAproxy config is broken for Redis timeout parameters. This is what we
have today by default in HAproxy logs:
[WARNING] 238/115010 (13878) : config : missing timeouts for proxy 'redis'.
| While not properly invalid, you will certainly encounter various problems
| with such a configuration. To fix this, please ensure that all following
| timeouts are set to a non-zero value: 'client', 'connect', 'server'.

This patch removes the explicit setting of client and server timeouts to 0,
which is the cause of the above warning.  Instead, Redis will simply inherit the
haproxy defaults, which should be a more reasonable setting, and result in no
warnings.

Change-Id: Ibe7941bec02f5facf21732910c9ad96f547ff8e5
"}]
commit_message:
loadbalancer: fix Redis timeout HAproxy config

Current HAproxy config is broken for Redis timeout parameters. This is what we
have today by default in HAproxy logs:
[WARNING] 238/115010 (13878) : config : missing timeouts for proxy 'redis'.
| While not properly invalid, you will certainly encounter various problems
| with such a configuration. To fix this, please ensure that all following
| timeouts are set to a non-zero value: 'client', 'connect', 'server'.

This patch removes the explicit setting of client and server timeouts to 0,
which is the cause of the above warning.  Instead, Redis will simply inherit the
haproxy defaults, which should be a more reasonable setting, and result in no
warnings.

Change-Id: Ibe7941bec02f5facf21732910c9ad96f547ff8e5

service won't start.

commit_message:
Implement TIMEOUT_SCALING_FACTOR for tempest

This is a pattern we've had in Nova for a while that allows individual
test classes to be marked as slower. This timeout adjustment is needed
for test_volume_boot_pattern because going up and down with 3 guests,
and cleaning them all up, plus volumes and snapshots, takes
time. Especially on slower personal equipment. These fail for people a
lot, which makes them think their devstack is broken. And it means
that it leaves crud around when it times out, which ruins follow on
runs.

Change-Id: Ibf21bdf44339d00f0291d0ff14eb6bcc69798ccc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/34/287434/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # A way to adjust slow test classes TIMEOUT_SCALING_FACTOR = 1 test_timeout = int(test_timeout) * self.TIMEOUT_SCALING_FACTOR

commit_message:
Refresh node power state at start of loop

When configuring boot on the baremetal nodes, we first do a list
and then iterate over the results.  This can be a minor hassle if
some of the nodes start out in a transitional power state because
the initial list results don't get updated before checking each
subsequent node.  We end up waiting the sleep time unnecessarily
until the node status is refreshed for every node that was in
transition, even though most of them have probably finished by the
time the first one or two do.

Also removes a later call to node.get since it is now
redundant.

Change-Id: I88d4c57167729cbfb24a9c2ca554738a7fbac3ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/09/283809/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

 - BGP speaker functionality.

commit_message:
Add devref for BGP Speaker

This patch adds the developer reference details about
- BGP Speaker functionality.
- BGP Dynamic routing scheduler functionality.
- BGP Dynamic routing agent functionality.
- BGP Dynamic routing driver functionality.

Change-Id: I2d72c156932a2288849745c4e0a6d53cf8d28602
Partially-Implements: blueprint bgp-dynamic-routing
Co-Authored-By: vikram.choudhary <vikram.choudhary@huawei.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/52/196452/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Guided Tour: The Neutron BGP Speaker API =========================================== https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron/BGPSpeaker API Extension ------------- The API extension is the 'front' end portion of the code, which handles defining a `REST-ful API`_, which is available only to admins. .. _`REST-ful API`: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron/tree/neutron/extensions/bgp_speaker.py Database API ------------ The BGP Speaker API extension adds a number of `methods to the database layer`_ of Neutron .. _`methods to the database layer`: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron/tree/neutron/db/bgp_speaker_db.py Logical Model ------------- # TODO(tidwellr) describe the logical model Agent RPC --------- The BGP Speaker reference implementation in Neutron uses the Neutron dr_agent to "speak" BGP route advertisements to peer routers. # TODO(tidwellr, vikram) fill in dr_agent RPC interface details Dynamic Routing Agent (dr_agent) -------------------------------- # TODO(vikram) fill in dr_agent implementation details

commit_message:
Moves the swift start/stop into the common_functions.sh file

Since swift isn't managed by pacemaker we need to manually (systemctl)
stop and start the swift services. This moves the duplicate blocks for
start/stop into a common function (we already include that
pacemaker_common_functions.sh here so may as well)

Change-Id: Ic4f23212594c1bf9edc39143bf60c7f6d648fd1d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/20/287320/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: systemctl_swift stop
deleted_lines: for S in openstack-swift-account-auditor openstack-swift-account-reaper openstack-swift-account-replicator openstack-swift-account \ openstack-swift-container-auditor openstack-swift-container-replicator openstack-swift-container-updater openstack-swift-container \ openstack-swift-object-auditor openstack-swift-object-replicator openstack-swift-object-updater openstack-swift-object openstack-swift-proxy; do systemctl stop $S done

commit_message:
puppet: allow config of ad-hoc Ceph settings

Including ::ceph::conf on ceph roles will allow ad-hoc
(non-puppet managed) settings to be made in the
ceph.conf using Hiera.

Change-Id: I656a0ecde465023d7afad9371aa3c5c270078a67
(cherry picked from commit 867b36625e38972e7a74989134a1f89dcbdc0fe7)

  which is possible when depending on chef-repo itself

commit_message:
Release senlinclient 0.4.0

The major changes since 0.3.0 is that senlinclient has added
openstackclient plugin support for all commands. That is the reason why
we bump version to 0.4.0 instead of 0.3.1.

Change-Id: Ia37ee459b1dbd8030453f97e1277471d3832f703

commit_message:
Libvirt needs openvswitch to connect br-int

Libvirt is trying to create a port on br-int and is
failing because ovs is not installed.

Co-authored-by: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: 1552717
Change-Id: I6ed0c1ae5b27b58e4c22bcbe7e674f66cde48990

subject: Move ssl params to [ssl]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-03 01:29:53.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/neutron_init_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/d4f299a4e2dc00e004fbcc7646c57c4d19be4d65', 'message': 'Move ssl params to [ssl]

SSL parameters should be in [ssl] section.
It will avoid this warning:
Option "ssl_key_file" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated. Use option key_file" from group "ssl"

Change-Id: I1f720c96bb62d386bf9b9bc72f28847e3b838318

commit_message:
Move ssl params to [ssl]

SSL parameters should be in [ssl] section.
It will avoid this warning:
Option "ssl_key_file" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated. Use option key_file" from group "ssl"

Change-Id: I1f720c96bb62d386bf9b9bc72f28847e3b838318
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/46/287546/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'DEFAULT/use_ssl': value => $use_ssl; 'ssl/cert_file': value => $cert_file; 'ssl/key_file': value => $key_file; 'ssl/ca_file': value => $ca_file;

commit_message:
Add explicit configuraton parameters for DB pool size

The default values for database pool size are too small for
a production environment. Defaults are:
max_pool_size = 5
max_overflow = 10
This patch adds explicit configuration to allow these
defaults to be increased as needed.

commit_message:
neutron server should not install lbaas or vpnaas agent

* currently if lbaas or vpnaas is enable, the neutron-server recipe will
  install the same packages as the node where lbaas-agent or vpnaas-agent is
  running on, while it just needs the python modules
* added attributes for definiton of python_dependencies for lbaas and vpnaas
  to allow neutron-server to have the modules without installing the full
  agent/service-packages

Change-Id: I1be325b7f246fa0628aed2d2a360acd604dd864a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-network refs/changes/41/287041/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # we need make sure neutron lbaas python packages get installed on network node before neutron-server start/restart, when lbaas is enabled. platform_options['neutron_lbaas_python_dependencies'].each do |pkg| # we need make sure neutron vpnaas python packages get installed on network node before neutron-server start/restart, when vpnaas is enabled. platform_options['neutron_vpnaas_python_dependencies'].each do |pkg|
deleted_lines: # we need make sure neutron lbaas packages get installed on network ndoe before neutron-server start/restart, when lbaas is enabled. platform_options['neutron_lbaas_packages'].each do |pkg| # we need make sure neutron vpnaas packages get installed on network node before neutron-server start/restart, when vpnaas is enabled. platform_options['neutron_vpnaas_packages'].each do |pkg|

commit_message:
removed bridge creation from recipes and splittet recipes

* removed the creation of ovs bridges (except br-int) from all recipes,
  since this can not be done in a sufficient generic way or only with a lot of
  case switches to cope with all possible network setups
* added an example recipe to create all default ovs bridges from the
  networking guide for legacy ovs setups (we should also create one for dvr later)
* splittet recipe ml2_openvswitch into seperate recipes for ml2_openvswitch config,
  openvswitch_agent and openvswitch to allow bridge creation from wrapper recipe inbetween
  and seperate configs from package installation

Change-Id: I6383575862ba110b3f3b5cba227288dc026fce77
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-network refs/changes/65/281965/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Encoding: utf-8 # # Cookbook Name:: openstack-network # Recipe:: _bridge_config_example # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. # # This recipe is intended as an example of just one possible bridge # configuration for ml2 and should not be used as is in production. The # openstack-network cookbook tries to provide all the basic features to deploy # the neutron services, but can not include all possible network and bridge # configurations out there. To use the openstack-network cookbook in production, # please create a wrapper to configure your network interfaces and adapt the # configs accordingly. You should find fitting examples given below. # set all the needed attributes # vlan bridge node.default['openstack']['network']['vlan_network_bridge_interface'] = 'eth1' node.default['openstack']['network']['plugins']['openvswitch']['conf'] .[]('OVS')['bridge_mappings'] = 'vlan:br-vlan,external:br-ex' # external bridge node.default['openstack']['network_l3']['external_network_bridge_interface'] = 'eth0' # tunnel bridge node.default['openstack']['network']['tun_network_bridge_interface'] = 'eth1' node.default['openstack']['network']['plugins']['openvswitch']['conf'] .[]('OVS')['tunnel_bridge'] = 'br-tun' node.default['openstack']['network']['plugins']['openvswitch']['conf'] .[]('OVS')['local_ip'] = address_for(node.default['openstack']['network']['tun_network_bridge_interface']) node.default['openstack']['network']['plugins']['openvswitch']['conf'] .[]('AGENT')['tunnel_types'] = 'gre,vxlan' # ovs security groups node.default['openstack']['network']['plugins']['openvswitch']['conf'] .[]('SECURITYGROUP')['firewall_driver'] = 'neutron.agent.linux.iptables_firewall.OVSHybridIptablesFirewallDriver' # define variables for bridge definitions below ext_bridge_iface = node['openstack']['network_l3']['external_network_bridge_interface'] vlan_bridge_iface = node['openstack']['network']['vlan_network_bridge_interface'] tun_bridge = node['openstack']['network']['plugins']['openvswitch']['conf'] .[]('OVS')['tunnel_bridge'] vlan, ex = node.default['openstack']['network']['plugins']['openvswitch']['conf'] .[]('OVS')['bridge_mappings'].split(',') vlan_bridge = vlan.split(':').last ex_bridge = ex.split(':').last execute 'create external network bridge' do command "ovs-vsctl --may-exist add-br #{ex_bridge} " action :run end execute 'create external network bridge port' do command "ovs-vsctl --may-exist add-port #{ext_bridge} #{ext_bridge_iface}" action :run end execute 'create vlan network bridge' do command "ovs-vsctl --may-exist add-br #{vlan_bridge}" action :run end execute 'create vlan network bridge port' do command "ovs-vsctl --may-exist add-port #{vlan_bridge} #{vlan_bridge_iface}" action :run end execute 'create tunnel network bridge' do command "ovs-vsctl --may-exist add-br #{tun_bridge}" action :run end

commit_message:
Correct return values for bridge sysctl calls

This fixes an issue where the lb agent did not plug the
dhcp tap device into the bridge when having vlan networking
set up.  Caused by setting of disable_ipv6 value.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/linux/bridge_lib.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/test_bridge_lib.py
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_bridge_lib.py

Closes-Bug: #1520618
Change-Id: I0d21fad3a676d1fdd30501ea6a295f1e9b207a3a
Co-Authored-By: Brian Haley <brian.haley@hpe.com>
(cherry picked from commit cac2436f298491dbca2c932c80bdf3a64ac39ee6)

    if req_version.matches("2.1", "2.5"):
        ....stuff....
    elif req_version.matches("2.6", "2.10"):
        ....other stuff....

However, the api_version_request.matches() function will not accept a
string, it requires an api_version_request object.

Also, to specify min_version or max_version as Null you must
instantiate an APIVersionRequest object, instead of just passing:
    if req_version.matches("2.1", None):

This fixes both cases.

Change-Id: I827403a436d0552fb443ad8204bf524fc1f05ac9
Closes-Bug: 1550337

commit_message:
api_version_request.matches does not accept a string or None

According to devref/api_microversion_dev.rst, you should be able
to use the following pattern:
    req_version = req.api_version_request
    if req_version.matches("2.1", "2.5"):
        ....stuff....
    elif req_version.matches("2.6", "2.10"):
        ....other stuff....

However, the api_version_request.matches() function will not accept a
string, it requires an api_version_request object.

Also, to specify min_version or max_version as Null you must
instantiate an APIVersionRequest object, instead of just passing:
    if req_version.matches("2.1", None):

This fixes both cases.

Change-Id: I827403a436d0552fb443ad8204bf524fc1f05ac9
Closes-Bug: 1550337

deleted_lines: if max_version.is_null() and min_version.is_null(): elif max_version.is_null(): elif min_version.is_null():

commit_message:
Switch keystone certs to parameter_defaults

All other client parameters are now passed via parameter_defaults,
which will be required to enable moving parameters within t-h-t to
accommodate split-stack and composable roles.

Change-Id: I9d8daea560661cde5502e053f8d417957ee3e2c6

commit_message:
No longer purge libvirt0

The package is no longer installed on recent infra nodes. Also the bug
that triggered the removal in the first place seems to have been
resolved some time ago [1].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/libvirt/+bug/1499199

commit_message:
[novaclient] Add announcements to dev mailing-list

README of requirements repo says "Internally consumed libraries should use
openstack-dev@lists.openstack.org. Server projects and client libraries
should use openstack-announce@lists.openstack.org."

python-novaclient is a client library, but it used internally in a lot of
OpenStack projects, so it is "internally consumed library" too and it would
be nice to announce new releases at dev mailing-list too.

Change-Id: I9838200d2d9a95e43bf73407ec96704e806558a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/15/287815/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fixes naming for the partitions in baremetal.

This fix differentiates between the partition names for
the baremetal and the iSCSI device names used by conductor.
This is required for supporting partition images for
ironic-python-agent and ironic agent drivers. The
ironic-python-agent should be able to
name the device partitions as /dev/sda1, /dev/sda2, etc.

Change-Id: I22bc29a39bf5c35f3eecb6d4e51cebd6aee0ce19
Partial-bug: 1526289

""" basename = os.path.basename(dev) return bool(_ISCSI_RE.match(basename)) if is_iscsi_device(dev): part_template = dev + '-part%d' else: part_template = dev + '%d'

commit_message:
Fix update all props when you delete image

Fix update all props when you delete an image from the database.
Extra updating image increases the load on the db.
Added update status to 'deleted' or 'pending_delete'.

Closes-bug: #1539006

Change-Id: If58862139ad8a3a45cdb5d3e84eca6358d40608b

subject: Functional backport for the new repo-build process
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-11 16:59:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/f5316156d9ded26161eec781186be39a9f4b93c0', 'message': "Functional backport for the new repo-build process

The change backports the repo-build role into kilo such that
we're allowing the Kilo build process to benifit from the changes
we've made upstream. This will also allow for the kilo playbooks
to clone from a repo using a generated manifest file. This will
ensure that the build process is more repatable, creating an
environment with faster build times, and dropping our dependency
on the yaprt library.

This change brings with it all of the assosiated updates that have been
made to the various plugins and playbooks to ensure a better repo-env.

The change back ports the repo-build role into kilo such that
we're allowing the Kilo build process to benefit from the changes
made in Liberty+. This will also allow for the Kilo playbooks
to clone from a repo using a generated manifest file. This will
ensure that the build process is more repeatable, creating an
environment with faster build times and drop the dependency
on the yaprt library.

This change brings with it all of the associated updates that have been
made to the various plugins and playbooks to ensure a better repo-env.

* the repo-* plays have been back ported from Liberty
* the repo-build role has been back ported
* the py_pkg lookup plugin changes have been back ported

* the repo-build role has been backported
* the py_pkg lookup plugin changes has been backported

Change-Id: I5a3a1506bf3df8b5812d9131248d0156a8dd7dd6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Functional backport for the new repo-build process

The change backports the repo-build role into kilo such that
we're allowing the Kilo build process to benifit from the changes
we've made upstream. This will also allow for the kilo playbooks
to clone from a repo using a generated manifest file. This will
ensure that the build process is more repatable, creating an
environment with faster build times, and dropping our dependency
on the yaprt library.

This change brings with it all of the assosiated updates that have been
made to the various plugins and playbooks to ensure a better repo-env.

* In the change the repo-* plays have been backported from liberty
* the repo-build role has been backported
* the py_pkg lookup plugin changes has been backported

Change-Id: I5a3a1506bf3df8b5812d9131248d0156a8dd7dd6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Changed the ordering for sudoers where used

The sudoers file was being created in the pre-install tasks
which causes an incorrect configuration variable to be dropped
when the venv env is not turned on. To correct this issue the
sudoers template is now dropped in the post install task file
after the bin_path fact has been set.

This change also removes the directory create task for heat, keystone,
glance, and swift because no sudoers files are needed for these services.

Change-Id: I609c9c12579dc1897787d19a1f58fe3e919b5e35
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Enable bindep / devstack cache for fedora23 nodes

Now that dnf support --downloadonly, we can properly use cache-bindep
and cache-devstack.

Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add documentation for Kolla plugin functionality

Every now and then people ask about plugins for Kolla. This conversation
may need to be revisted in more detail soon, but till then it's worth
highlighting what we do currently support in Kolla.

Right now adding the block as shown in this patch will make the plugin
archive available in the image, but currently only Neutron has
Dockerfile directives to automatically install them if present. The same
can be added very easily for other commonly pluggable services such as
Horizon.

Change-Id: Ia52d5ccf753667c5452b19fcaf4bf5b893a59fd0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/88/286688/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Plugin Functionality -------------------- .. note:: The following functionality currently exists only for Neutron. Other services will be made pluggable in Kolla in the near future. Certain OpenStack services support third party plugins, e.g. Neutron's pluggable L2 drivers_. Kolla supports downloading pip installable archives as part of the build, which will then be picked up and installed in the relevant image. To instruct Kolla to use these, add a section to ``/etc/kolla/kolla-build.conf`` in the following format: :: [<image>-plugin-<plugin-name>] Where, ``<image>`` is the image that the plugin should be installed into, and ``<plugin-name>`` is an identifier of your choice. For example, to install the Cisco L2 plugin for Neutron into the neutron-server image, one would add the following block to ``/etc/kolla/kolla-build.conf``: :: [neutron-server-plugin-networking-cisco] type = git location = https://github.com/openstack/networking-cisco reference = master .. _drivers: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron#Plugins

commit_message:
endpoint_map: bump nova api from 2.0 to 2.1

Nova v2.1 allows to use the same API as 2.0 but with microversions
support, which is the recommended way to discover the latest API
version supported in the cloud.

Change-Id: Id011de03d883001fd48dbbcfed53cb821607c7f3

commit_message:
Fix openstack-cinder idempotency

This change moves the service tweak for cinder-backup to only be
included when we include cinder::backup. Currently if we do not have the
manage volumes configured for an environment, the openstack-cinder task
will not be idempotent because of this service tweak.

Change-Id: Idcc12f2d9623f66926ee8bb0b7917f79e666e6f8
Closes-Bug: #1552418
Related-Blueprint: granular-task-idempotency

commit_message:
Update CIMC driver docs to install ImcSdk from PyPi

ImcSdk is now available on PyPi, driver_requirements.txt was updated to
reflect this, but the Ironic driver doc was brought up to date, this
patch fixes that.

Change-Id: Ib9195d50f0a208a814e13d859cadd577d05aed54
Closes-Bug: #1552720

commit_message:
Do not use explict keyword arguments in image resource

New keyword argument was introduced in new novaclient for
base resource. Because of that, we should not use explicit keyword.

Change-Id: I1bda75920e034147be39dc3eff607ab7ab23840a
Closes-bug: 1552674

commit_message:
Fix the TTL issue of subscriptions for Redis

Currently, the TTL of subscriptons doesn't work. That said, after
the ttl seconds, the subscription can't be deleted. This pathch
fixes it and a functional test will be added in Zaqar client.

Partial-Bug: #1529168

Change-Id: I0c6a965347701bcfbf6d5634c7c8303d1e74ecc2

deleted_lines: ttl = int(ttl) expires = now + ttl 'e': expires,

commit_message:
Add missing content-length header

This patch adds missing content-length header
param into swift_upload_object() method.
Without it object upload handling could be failed
with "411 Length Required" error if Ceph is used
as an object storage.

Change-Id: Id0813806abb36a6f015efd13ec987492a3701476
Closes-Bug: #1352256

commit_message:
Fix swift log perms

The change adjusts the permissions on the siwft logging directory
to ensure syslog is always able to read and write logs to the
proper location.

Change-Id: Ic2dc66167db4158b8ea0dcb6157ddb1d0d55df66
Closes-Bug: #1539207
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/11/275311/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: chown -h syslog:syslog "/var/log/swift" chown -R syslog:syslog "$(readlink /var/log/swift)"
deleted_lines: chown -h {{ swift_system_user_name }}:{{ swift_system_group_name }} "/var/log/swift" chown -R {{ swift_system_user_name }}:{{ swift_system_group_name }} "$(readlink /var/log/swift)"

subject: Forbid replica provisioning from replica site

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-08 14:14:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/cdcd22bc59c2a357b85af7f0fecf6993e808cfcc', 'message': 'Forbid replica provisioning from non-root replica site

Reasons:
- Replication V1 should allow only flat hierarchy - one root replica
  with multiple read replicas. Trove should forbid attempts to create
  slave of slave of slave and so on.

Changes:

  root replica (slave_if_id) is not an actual root (is a read replica any

commit_message:
Forbid replica provisioning from replica site

Reasons:
- Replication V1 should allow only flat hierarchy - one root replica
  with multiple read replicas. Trove should forbid attempts to create
  slave of slave of slave and so on.

Changes:
 - adding validation step that forbids read replica provisioning if passed
   replica source (slave_if_id) is not an actual source (is a read replica any
   other replica source)
 - unit test added

Co-Authored-By: Iccha Sethi <iccha.sethi@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: Ic467b2eb01194f95a30f7ce9d921d3fa942b086e
Closes-Bug: #1357707

added_lines: from trove.instance import models def patch_instance(self, instance_id, task_status=models.InstanceTasks. BUILDING_ERROR_SERVER): db_info = models.DBInstance.get_by(id=instance_id, deleted=False) db_info.update( task_status=task_status) def _poll(self, instance_id): def result_is_active(): instance = instance_info.dbaas.instances.get(instance_id) if instance.status == "ACTIVE": return True else: assert_true(instance.status in ['BUILD']) return False return result_is_active @test def test_create_replica_from_non_root_replica(self): if not CONFIG.fake_mode: raise SkipTest("Enabled only for fake mode testing.") root_replica = instance_info.dbaas.instances.create( instance_info.name, instance_info.dbaas_flavor_href, instance_info.volume ) poll_until(self._poll(root_replica.id)) non_root_replica = instance_info.dbaas.instances.create( instance_info.name + "_slave", instance_info.dbaas_flavor_href, instance_info.volume, slave_of=root_replica.id) poll_until(self._poll(non_root_replica.id)) # raised HTTP exception at client side is wrong, # should be HTTP 403 instead of HTTP 401, # see https://bugs.launchpad.net/trove/+bug/1351296 assert_raises(exceptions.Unauthorized, instance_info.dbaas.instances.create, instance_info.name + "_slave", instance_info.dbaas_flavor_href, instance_info.volume, slave_of=non_root_replica.id) assert_equal(401, instance_info.dbaas.last_http_code)

commit_message:
Datastore Log Operations

Specification for the retrieval of logs from the guest agent
in Trove.

APIImpact

Co-Authored-By: Morgan Jones <morgan@tesora.com>
Co-Authored-By: Peter Stachowski <peter@tesora.com>
Change-Id: I0ec2203fa1b1fcfd4ee2b18c9d7fb08c225736ab
Related: blueprint datastore-log-operations
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-specs refs/changes/68/188168/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode Sections of this template were taken directly from the Nova spec template at: https://github.com/openstack/nova-specs/blob/master/specs/template.rst .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/trove/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst. Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None ============= Trove Logging ============= URL of launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/trove/+spec/datastore-log-operations Problem description =================== In the current implementation, it is not possible for the user to retrieve any logs from the guest agent without ssh access to the instance. The user should be able to retrieve logs as defined by the datastore. Proposed change =============== * Leaving this to remind myself to add APIImpact (and DocImpact?) in commit message* This document outlines a proposal to provide access to guest logs by storing them in a Swift container. Each datastore will define a number of log files which it can make available to the user. Logs can be either system logs such as the Trove guest-agent log which are always enabled, or the log can be user logs such as the MySQL Slow Query Log which can be enabled or disabled by the user. The contents of the appropriate log files will be copied from the guest instance to a Swift container via execution of a log-publish command, and may then be streamed to the user. Subsquent invocations of the log-publish command will only copy log entries made since the last log-publish command to efficiently utilize network resources and miniize impact on database performance. Swift Log Container ------------------- Each log will be composed of multiple objects stored in a Swift container, each object being a subset of the logging information. The entire log will be reconstructed by concatenating the objects in the container; order can be determined by examining the object metadata for each object, or simply by alphabetically sorting the objects by filename (assuming a suitable naming convention). Each container will have the following metadata associated with it: ============ =========== Key Value ============ =========== Log Name Name of log Log Type SYS or USER Publish Date Timestamp of last publish command executed by Trove guest Last Log Filename of log at last publish Log Size Log file size at last publish ============ =========== A log container could be viewed with the following command:: $ curl -i http://swift.openstack.org/log-slow_query-aa6ef0f5-dbef-48cd-8952-573ad881e717?format=json -X GET -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" Response:: HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Length: 341 X-Container-Object-Count: 2 Accept-Ranges: bytes X-Container-Meta-Log-Name: slow_query X-Container-Meta-Log-Type: USER X-Container-Meta-Publish-Date: Wed, 15 Jan 2014 16:53:35 GMT X-Container-Meta-Last-Log: slow_query.log X-Container-Meta-Log-Size: 15342 X-Timestamp: 1389727543.65372 X-Container-Bytes-Used: 26 Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8 X-Trans-Id: tx26377fe5fab74869825d1-0052d6bdff Date: Wed, 15 Jan 2014 16:57:35 GMT [ { "hash": "451e372e48e0f6b1114fa0724aa79fa1", "last_modified": "2014-01-15T13:41:49.390270", "bytes": 3243, "lines": 506, "name": "log-2014-01-15T13:41:49.390270", "content_type": "application/octet-stream" }, { "hash": "ed076287532e86365e841e92bfc50d8c", "last_modified": "2014-01-15T16:37:43.427570", "bytes": 12453, "lines": 6280, "name": "log-2014-01-15T16:37:43.427570", "content_type": "application/octet-stream" } ] Each object will have the following metadata associated with it: ============ =========== Key Value ============ =========== Log Lines Number of lines in the Swift object ============ =========== A log object could be viewed with the following command:: $ curl -i http://swift.openstack.org/log-slow_query-aa6ef0f5-dbef-48cd-8952-573ad881e717/log-2014-01-15T13:41:49.390270 -X GET -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" Response:: HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Length: 3243 Accept-Ranges: bytes X-Object-Meta-Lines: 506 Last-Modified: Wed, 15 Jan 2014 13:41:49 GMT Etag: 451e372e48e0f6b1114fa0724aa79fa1 X-Timestamp: 1389804109.39027 Content-Type: application/octet-stream X-Trans-Id: tx8145a190241f4cf6b05f5-0052d82a34 X-Delete-At: 1389964109.39027 Date: Thu, 16 Jan 2014 18:51:32 GMT /usr/local/mysql/libexec/mysqld, Version: 3.23.54-log, started with: Tcp port: 3306 Unix socket: /tmp/mysql.sock Time Id Command Argument # Time: 030207 15:03:33 # User@Host: wsuser[wsuser] @ localhost.localdomain [127.0.0.1] # Query_time: 13 Lock_time: 0 Rows_sent: 117 Rows_examined: 234 use wsdb; SELECT l FROM un WHERE ip='209.xx.xxx.xx'; Configuration ------------- Datastore CONF settings: - guest_log_limit - max size for any chunk pushed to Swift - guest_log_expiry - time in seconds after which the log component is removed from the Swift container - log_expose - Used to configure which logs will be exposed by logging component - guest_log_container_name - pattern used to generate the name of the contain which will hold the logs - guest_log_object_name - pattern used to generate the name of each object in the container guest_log_expose //////////////// A guest_log_expose config value will enumerate the logs available for a datastore; of course, only logs actually supported by the datastore's guestagent manager would be supported. Excerpt from trove-guestagent.conf:: guest_log_expose: mysql_error, guest, slow_query, general Any log not mentioned in the guest_log_expose list will be disabled by default. A special value of "ALL" will enable all logs supported by the guest agent manager. guest_log_container_name //////////////////////// The name of the container used to store log components will be generated from the guest_log_container_name config value. Excerpt from trove-guestagent.conf: guest_log_container_name: log-%(datastore)s-%(log)s-%(instance_id)s The value shown above is the default value. The following variables are available for substitution: - datastore - the name of the datastore (mysql) - log - the log type (guest) - instance_id - the id of the instance (a UUID) guest_log_object_name ///////////////////// The name of objects within the log container will be generated from the guest_log_object_name config value. Excerpt from trove-guestagent.conf: guest_log_object_name: log-%(timestamp)s The value shown above is the default value. The following variables are available for substitution: - timestamp - the time at which the object is created ("2015-10-12T15:30:27.0493") - datastore - the name of the datastore (mysql) - log - the log type (guest) - instance_id - the id of the instance (a UUID) Database -------- n/a REST API -------- For log-list: Request:: GET v1/instance/{id}/log Response:: { 'logs' : [ { 'name': 'guest', 'type': 'SYS', 'status': 'ON', 'publishable': '4234', 'container': 'log-m-guest-<id>' }, { 'name': 'slow_query', 'type': 'USER', 'status': 'ON', 'publishable': '342', 'container': 'log-m-slow_query-<id>' } ] } For log-publish: Request:: POST v1/instance/{id}/log { 'disable': 'True' } Response:: { 'log': { 'name': 'guest', 'type': 'SYS', 'status': 'ON', 'publishable': '4234', 'container': 'log-m-guest-<id>' } ] } For log-tail: Request:: GET v1/instance/{id}/log-name/{name} Response:: { 'log-name': 'log-m-guest-<id>' } Python API ---------- :: def log_list(self, instance): """Get a list of all guest logs. :param instance: The :class:`Instance` (or its ID) of the database instance to get the log from. :rtype: list of :class:`Log`. """ def log_publish(self, instance, log, disable=None): """Publish guest log to swift container. :param instance: The :class:`Instance` (or its ID) of the database instance to get the log from. :param log: The type of <log> to publish :param disable: Turn off <log> and delete the associated container :rtype: List of :class:`Log`. """ def log_generator(self, instance, log, publish=None, lines=50): """Return generator to yield the last <lines> lines of guest log. :param instance: The :class:`Instance` (or its ID) of the database instance to to get the log from. :param log: The type of <log> to publish :param publish: Publish updates before displaying log :param lines: Display last <lines> lines of log (0 for all lines) :rtype: generator function to yield log as chunks. """ def log_save(self, instance, log, publish=None, filename=None): """Saves a guest log to a file. :param instance: The :class:`Instance` (or its ID) of the database instance to get the log from. :param log: The type of <log> to publish :param publish: Publish updates before displaying log :rtype: Filename to which log was saved """ CLI Commands ------------ Log List ======== :: $ trove log-list <instance> +-------------+------+--------+-------------+----------------------------------+ + Name + Type + Status + Pending + Container + +-------------+------+--------+-------------+----------------------------------+ + guest_agent + SYS + ON + 2139 + log-guest_agent-<instance> + + mysql_error + SYS + ON + 0 + + + slow_query + USER + OFF + + + + general + USER + ON + 34233 + log-general-<instance> + +-------------+------+--------+-------------+----------------------------------+ +-------------+-------------------------------------------------------+ + Column + Description + +=============+=======================================================+ + Name + Name of the log component + +-------------+-------------------------------------------------------+ + Type + SYS: System log, always on + + +------+------------------------------------------------+ + + USER: Managed by user + +-------------+-------------------------------------------------------+ + Status + ON: Logging operational + + +------+------------------------------------------------+ + + OFF: Log not collected + +-------------+-------------------------------------------------------+ + Pending + Amount of data available to be logged by log-publish + +-------------+-------------------------------------------------------+ + Container + Swift container which holds the components of the log + +-------------+-------------------------------------------------------+ **Note: the value for Container for the mysql_error log in the example above is empty. This signifies that that log has not had a log-publish operation executed against it** The log-list command provides information about each log available on a given Trove instance. Log Publish =========== :: $ trove log-publish <instance> slow_query +-------------------+---------------------------+ | Property | Value | +-------------------+---------------------------+ | name | slow_query | | type | SYS | | status | ON | | publishable | 43242 | | container | log-slow_query-<instance> | +-------------------+---------------------------+ The log-publish command will instruct the guest agent to push any updates to the specified log to the Swift container, which will be created if required. One log-publish command could result in multiple objects being pushed to the Swift container in order to keep each object below the maximum object size as configured by the <datastore>.guest_log_limit CONF value. The log-publish command will execute asynchronously. When the log-publish command is executed, the Trove instance will be put in the LOGGING state, returning to ACTIVE when objects have been pushed to the logging container so as to successfully finish execution of the command; the state will go to ERROR in the event of an exception. When an object is pushed to the Swift container, an X-Delete-After header is used to specify a time-to-live for the container object. This will result in objects automatically being removed from the container after a period of time as specified by the <datastore>.log_expiry CONF value. An optional --disable parameter will be supported to disable logging for a particular log. For USER logs, logging will be disabled on the guest and the associated container will be deleted. For SYS logs, the associated container will be deleted. Log Tail ======== :: $ trove log-tail <instance> slow_query --publish /usr/local/mysql/libexec/mysqld, Version: 3.23.54-log, started with: Tcp port: 3306 Unix socket: /tmp/mysql.sock Time Id Command Argument # Time: 030207 15:03:33 # User@Host: wsuser[wsuser] @ localhost.localdomain [127.0.0.1] # Query_time: 13 Lock_time: 0 Rows_sent: 117 Rows_examined: 234 use wsdb; SELECT l FROM un WHERE ip='209.xx.xxx.xx'; By default, log-tail outputs the last 100 lines at the end of the log. With the --lines=n option, log-tail will output the last n lines of the log. If n is negative, output will start past line n and continue to the end; --lines=0 will output the entire log. With the --publish option, log-tail will first execute a log-publish command and wait for the log to be published before beginning output. It should be noted that the actual display of the log will take place in the Python API only. There will be no REST APIs to facilitate display of the log; such APIs would put undue stress on the system due to the requirements of buffering and streaming from Swift. Log Save ======== :: $ trove log-save <instance> slow_query --file=/tmp/my.log --publish Like the log-tail command, the log-save command will execute in the python-troveclient, but where log-tail will output the log to the console, the log-save command will save the log into a file in the filesystem. This will allow the user to download extremely large log files without overwhelming the client or browser. With the --file option, the log will be saved to the named file. Without the --file option, the log will be output to <logname>.log in the current directory. With the --publish option, log-tail will first execute a log-publish command and wait for the log to be published before beginning output. It should be noted that the actual saving of the log will take place in the Python API only. There will be no REST APIs to facilitate display of the log; such APIs would put undue stress on the system due to the requirements of buffering and streaming from Swift. Public API Security ------------------- The Swift containers will be created with the same security credentials as used for backup. Internal API ------------ Appropriate API methods will be added to both the task manager and the guest. No changes to existing APIs are foreseen. Guest Agent ----------- No compatibility issues are foreseen. Alternatives ------------ Alternate API ///////////// An alternatve API could be implemented to be more in line with other Openstack functionality: ============== ============ API Description ============== ============ log-create Creates the Swift container for the log log-publish Copy log data to the container log-disable Stops logging on guest (i.e., slow query log) log-delete Deletes the Swift container log-list As above log-tail As above log-save As above ============== ============ Of note in this alternative implementation, the log-publish command would not have a --disable option and the log-delete command could allow you to delete the container for a log for which logging was still enabled. --publish by default //////////////////// There has also been a suggestion to make the --publish option the default on the log-tail and log-save commands. If this were done, it seems unlikely that anyone would ever execute --no-publish and the log-publish command would really only ever execute "log-publish --disable", so it would be better to just eliminate the --publish/--no-publish options, have log-tail and log-save always publish first, and replace the log-publish command with log-disable. Admin override for guest log //////////////////////////// It is possible for the operator to exclude the guest agent log from the list of logs returned to the user. Doing so, however, would prevent the operator from seeing the guest log. An alternative would be to have a mode which allowed the operator to exclude the guest log from the list of logs that the user sees, but allow the operator to access the log via the logging interface. [How would the guest know that the user executing the log-* command has admin priveleges?] Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: vgnbkr (morgan@tesora.com) Documentation: lmichaels@tesora.com Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Liberty-3 Work Items ---------- This component has been prototyped and largely implemented. The following functionality is outstanding: * Enable/disable of USER logs (slow query and general logs for mysql) * Reporting of Pending bytes in log-list * Deletion of the Swift container * tests Upgrade Implications ==================== As this is entirely new functionality, no upgrade implications are foreseen. Dependencies ============ n/a Testing ======= An integration test will be added to retrieve the guest log, execute a command, retrieve the guest log again and confirm that additional logging details were captured. The log will then be deleted via the log-publish --disable command and the removal of the container from Swift will be verified. Documentation Impact ==================== New documentation describing the added functionality will need to be written. References ========== https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/trove-2015-vancouver-logging
