subject: Api_version_request.matches does not accept a string or None
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-02 13:47:01.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/api_microversion_dev.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6e1d1189d7e3c77645a004a2c4c304172d3990ab', 'message': 'Api_version_request.matches does not accept a string or None

According to the Cinder devref (https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/doc/source/devref/api_microversion_dev.rst)
you should be able to use the following pattern:

def index(self, req):
    <common code>

    req_version = req.api_version_request
    if req_version.matches("3.1", "3.5"):
        ....stuff....
    elif req_version.matches("3.6", "3.10"):
        ....other stuff....
    elif req_version > api_version_request.APIVersionRequest("3.10"):
        ....more stuff.....

    <common code>

However, the api_version_request.matches() function will not accept a string, it requires an api_version_request object.

Remove this from the devref documentation, since it will not work.

Change-Id: I2facfa4a3e5f4bbfc567a37fa004bb7cb336af02
Closes-Bug: #1550337
'}]
commit_message:
Api_version_request.matches does not accept a string or None

According to the Cinder devref (https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/doc/source/devref/api_microversion_dev.rst)
you should be able to use the following pattern:

def index(self, req):
    <common code>

    req_version = req.api_version_request
    if req_version.matches("3.1", "3.5"):
        ....stuff....
    elif req_version.matches("3.6", "3.10"):
        ....other stuff....
    elif req_version > api_version_request.APIVersionRequest("3.10"):
        ....more stuff.....

    <common code>

However, the api_version_request.matches() function will not accept a string, it requires an api_version_request object.

Remove this from the devref documentation, since it will not work.

Change-Id: I2facfa4a3e5f4bbfc567a37fa004bb7cb336af02
Closes-Bug: #1550337
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/94/287194/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: When not using decorators ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ When you don't want to use the ``@api_version`` decorator on a method or you want to change behavior within a method (say it leads to simpler or simply a lot less code) you can directly test for the requested version with a method as long as you have access to the api request object (commonly called ``req``). Every API method has an api_version_request object attached to the req object and that can be used to modify behavior based on its value:: def index(self, req): <common code> req_version = req.api_version_request if req_version.matches("2.1", "2.5"): ....stuff.... elif req_version.matches("2.6", "2.10"): ....other stuff.... elif req_version > api_version_request.APIVersionRequest("2.10"): ....more stuff..... <common code> The first argument to the matches method is the minimum acceptable version and the second is maximum acceptable version. A specified version can be null:: null_version = APIVersionRequest() If the minimum version specified is null then there is no restriction on the minimum version, and likewise if the maximum version is null there is no restriction the maximum version. Alternatively a one sided comparison can be used as in the example above.

commit_message:
OpenContrail heat templates

Deploy a TripleO overcloud with OpenContrail Vrouter plugin configured
to interact with an existing OpenContrail Server Manager.

OpenContrail is an Apache 2.0-licensed project that is built using
standards-based protocols and provides all the necessary components for
network virtualizationSDN controller, virtual router, analytics engine,
and published northbound APIs. It has an extensive REST API to configure
and gather operational and analytics data from the system.

Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I699a7c4ea09d024fe4d70c6a507c524f0a7aafd5
(cherry picked from commit fd922970e86d62d3da7ea5bbde37418fdbcb248e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/59/286559/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if hiera('neutron::core_plugin') == 'neutron_plugin_contrail.plugins.opencontrail.contrail_plugin.NeutronPluginContrailCoreV2' { include ::neutron::plugins::opencontrail }

commit_message:
Remove dangling Default domain cfg file

The multi-domain LDAP support added in
Ifa4c42f7dbcc40a256a3156f74f0150384f9ab87 left behind a
keystone.Default.conf file that causes Keystone errors when adding a
new domain backed by LDAP. This patch removes the file unless the
deployer has specifically created a domain called 'Default'.

Closes-bug: 1547542

Change-Id: I50ca6c1133c663aa374e45a04f7d0d53171d6941
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/68/282368/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - The addition of multi-domain LDAP configuration support left behind a configuration file for the default domain that causes problems with Keystone. This file will automatically be removed if the deployer is not using the Default domain with an LDAP back end. (`Bug 1547542 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1547542>`_)

commit_message:
Remove all references of with_venv.sh

With the removal of oslo.incubator from the keystone project [0], we should clean up references to the with_venv.sh script from the project development documentation [1], since it is no longer used

Change-Id: I170e21641fca152b2e7bec4a9224663bc0140f82
Closes-Bug: #1514792

commit_message:
TypeError when user show user_id and specifiying the domain

When the openstackclient tries to find a resource from a
project it calls a 'get()' on the manager and passes it the
id_or_name and kwargs. How most get() methods are set up
they only accept an id or name, and not kwargs.  Because this is
wrapped in a try no one has noticed there is a problem. This fix
adds another call to the manager with no kwargs if a TypeError
is returned. The TypeError occurs because the incorrect arguments
are passed to the managers get().

Change-Id: I7033239049ff42f6ac615713adfd1a88d9f804af
Closes-Bug: #1546663
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/24/281524/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add schema validation to fix v2 code error returns
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-21 16:47:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/a86a50f3c67214d8bd1eaf851c4fdff0246bee32', 'message': 'Add schema validation to fix v2 code error returns

For now, if user sends a bad request, v2 API returns unreasonable
code error message. This is unfriendly to end users.

For example, the curl request of a POST request with an empty body
$ curl -H "X-Auth-Token:$TOKEN" -X POST localhost:35357/v2.0/users
  -H 'Content-Type:application/json' -d '{}'

produces this return message:
{"error": {"message": "create_user() takes exactly 3 arguments
(2 given)", "code": 400, "title": "Bad Request"}}

After patch, new return message is:
{"error": {"message": "Expecting to find user in request body -
the server could not comply with the request since it is either
malformed or otherwise incorrect. The client is assumed to be in
error.", "code": 400, "title": "Bad Request"}}

This new return message matches what is on v3.
The patch fixes this by adding schema validation to v2.
For now, API schema validation is only on v3.

This can help improve end user experience.

Closes-Bug: #1455298
Change-Id: I65bfc1b7783e2b2ae938e3c4429f5acf3af9d1af

commit_message:
Add schema validation to fix v2 code error returns

For now, if user sends a bad request, v2 API returns unreasonable
code error message. This is unfriendly to end users.

For example, the curl request of a POST request with an empty body
$ curl -H "X-Auth-Token:$TOKEN" -X POST localhost:35357/v2.0/users
  -H 'Content-Type:application/json' -d '{}'

produces this return message:
{"error": {"message": "create_user() takes exactly 3 arguments
(2 given)", "code": 400, "title": "Bad Request"}}

After patch, new return message is:
{"error": {"message": "Expecting to find user in request body -
the server could not comply with the request since it is either
malformed or otherwise incorrect. The client is assumed to be in
error.", "code": 400, "title": "Bad Request"}}

This new return message matches what is on v3.
The patch fixes this by adding schema validation to v2.
For now, API schema validation is only on v3.

This can help improve end user experience.

Closes-Bug: #1455298
Change-Id: I65bfc1b7783e2b2ae938e3c4429f5acf3af9d1af

commit_message:
Restore the authorized_keys file in 'cobbler' container

SSH restore must go before Cobbler restore to ensure
that /etc/cobbler/authorized_keys file is updated
with appropriate public key.

Change-Id: Ie9493e883885cfc167920bfe35d5545d05c378e9
Closes-bug: 1551339
(cherry picked from commit f78d006175cf9c158d3c196702b1db1a4d234ddf)

commit_message:
Lightweight testing to test neutron/networking-odl without ODL

The lightweight testing code itself maintains the resources
created by neutron, and conducts sanity verification for
get/put/delete.

Change-Id: I2c4331adc30d3006dca91f1589bc351189bb1af9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/37/225037/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import mock from networking_odl.common import constants as odl_const from oslo_config import cfglightweight_testing_opts = [ cfg.BoolOpt('enable_odl_lightweight_testing', default=False, help='Test without real ODL') ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(lightweight_testing_opts) self.lwt_dict = {odl_const.ODL_NETWORKS: {}, odl_const.ODL_SUBNETS: {}, odl_const.ODL_PORTS: {}, odl_const.ODL_SGS: {}, odl_const.ODL_SG_RULES: {}, odl_const.ODL_LOADBALANCERS: {}, odl_const.ODL_LISTENERS: {}, odl_const.ODL_POOLS: {}, odl_const.ODL_MEMBERS: {}, odl_const.ODL_HEALTHMONITORS: {}} self.sendjson = self._sendjson if cfg.CONF.enable_odl_lightweight_testing: self.sendjson = self.lwt_sendjson LOG.debug("ODL lightweight testing is enabled") def _sendjson(self, method, urlpath, obj): def lwt_sendjson(self, method, urlpath, obj): """Lightweight testing without ODL""" not_found = requests.codes.not_found not_allowed = requests.codes.method_not_allowed resource_type = str(urlpath).split('/')[0] resource_type = resource_type.replace('-', '_') if resource_type not in self.lwt_dict: response = mock.Mock(status_code=not_found) raise requests.exceptions.HTTPError(response=response) resource_dict = self.lwt_dict[resource_type] if method == "post": """ No ID in URL, obj must have ID""" for key in obj: if not isinstance(obj[key], list): resource = obj[key] if resource['id'] not in resource_dict: resource_dict[resource['id']] = resource else: LOG.debug("%s %s already exists" % (resource_type, resource[id])) response = mock.Mock(status_code=not_allowed) raise requests.exceptions.HTTPError(response=response) else: """Post a list of resources""" for resource in obj[key]: if resource['id'] not in resource_dict: resource_dict[resource['id']] = resource else: LOG.debug("%s %s already exists" % (resource_type, resource[id])) resp = mock.Mock(status_code=not_allowed) raise requests.exceptions.HTTPError(response=resp) return if method == "put": resource_id = str(urlpath).split('/')[-1] if resource_id != '': """Put a single item""" if resource_id in resource_dict: for key in obj: resource = obj[key] resource_dict[resource_id] = resource else: LOG.debug("%s %s does not exist" % (resource_type, resource_id)) response = mock.Mock(status_code=not_found) raise requests.exceptions.HTTPError(response=response) return """Put a list of items, each item should have 'id'""" for key in obj: for resource in obj[key]: if resource['id'] in resource_dict: resource_dict[resource['id']] = resource else: LOG.debug("%s %s does not exist" % (resource_type, resource[id])) response = mock.Mock(status_code=not_found) raise requests.exceptions.HTTPError(response=response) return if method == "delete": resource_id = str(urlpath).split('/')[-1] if resource_id != '': """Delete a single item""" if resource_id in resource_dict: resource_dict.pop(resource_id) else: LOG.debug("%s %s does not exist" % (resource_type, resource_id)) response = mock.Mock(status_code=not_found) raise requests.exceptions.HTTPError(response=response) return """Put a list of items, each item should have 'id'""" for key in obj: for resource in obj[key]: if resource['id'] in resource_dict: resource_dict.pop(resource['id']) else: LOG.debug("%s %s does not exist" % (resource_type, resource['id'])) response = mock.Mock(status_code=not_found) raise requests.exceptions.HTTPError(response=response) return if method == "get": resource_id = str(urlpath).split('/')[-1] if resource_id != '': if resource_id in resource_dict: return resource_dict[resource_id].copy() else: LOG.debug("%s %s does not exist" % (resource_type, resource_id)) response = mock.Mock(status_code=not_found) raise requests.exceptions.HTTPError(response=response) else: r_list = [] for resource in resource_dict: r_list.append(resource) return r_list

commit_message:
refactor: Merge all debug logging at the beginning of take_action

After refactoring made in this series of patches,
all neutronclient commands implements take_action().
Debug logging at the beginning of take_action can be
implemented in a signle place.

Change-Id: Ic766c0bd0f203b2408dc459247804c7d9290b0d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/87/265287/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
refactor: Avoid overriding run() in cliff command

cliff Command subclasses are suggested to override take_action.
run() method is reserved for extending base classes.
Thus, this commit changes to implement take_action() instead of run().

Closes-Bug: #1532258
Change-Id: Id845a80dbad2f436df5a55c9be502068e6f7b291

commit_message:
Q_ML2_PLUGIN_MECHANISM_DRIVERS should not always be overrode

User should be able to specify the Q_ML2_PLUGIN_MECHANISM_DRIVERS with
opendaylight_v2 instead of being overrode all the time.

Change-Id: Idfc6d3b6ea14df55eab8bff20f24144da66161f7
Closes-Bug:#1545646

commit_message:
Add image/flavor validation to Rackspace Server

The image and flavor used to build a Rackspace server must
satisfy certain properties to successfully build the server.
This patch adds Rackspace Public Cloud specific validation
to enable such checking so that invalid combinations are
discovered before the start of stack creation.

Change-Id: I2f676b5c06190ddc1077c13bbe3482a23d1d01fd
Co-Authored-By: Anna Eilering <anna.eilering@rackspace.com>, Jason Dunsmore <jasondunsmore@gmail.com>

added_lines: from heat.engine import rsrc_defn @mock.patch.object(resource.Resource, "client_plugin") @mock.patch.object(resource.Resource, "client") class CloudServersValidationTests(common.HeatTestCase): def setUp(self): super(CloudServersValidationTests, self).setUp() resource._register_class("OS::Nova::Server", cloud_server.CloudServer) properties_server = { "image": "CentOS 5.2", "flavor": "256 MB Server", "key_name": "test", "user_data": "wordpress", } self.mockstack = mock.Mock() self.mockstack.has_cache_data.return_value = False self.mockstack.db_resource_get.return_value = None self.rsrcdef = rsrc_defn.ResourceDefinition( "test", cloud_server.CloudServer, properties=properties_server) def test_validate_no_image(self, mock_client, mock_plugin): server = cloud_server.CloudServer("test", self.rsrcdef, self.mockstack) mock_boot_vol = self.patchobject( server, '_validate_block_device_mapping') mock_boot_vol.return_value = True mock_plugin().get_image.return_value = None self.assertIsNone(server.validate()) def test_validate_no_image_bfv(self, mock_client, mock_plugin): server = cloud_server.CloudServer("test", self.rsrcdef, self.mockstack) mock_boot_vol = self.patchobject( server, '_validate_block_device_mapping') mock_boot_vol.return_value = True mock_flavor = mock.Mock(ram=4) mock_flavor.to_dict.return_value = { 'OS-FLV-WITH-EXT-SPECS:extra_specs': { 'class': 'standard1', }, } mock_plugin().get_flavor.return_value = mock_flavor mock_plugin().get_image.return_value = None error = self.assertRaises( exception.StackValidationFailed, server.validate) self.assertEqual( 'Flavor 256 MB Server cannot be booted from volume.', six.text_type(error)) def test_validate_bfv_volume_only(self, mock_client, mock_plugin): server = cloud_server.CloudServer("test", self.rsrcdef, self.mockstack) mock_flavor = mock.Mock(ram=4) mock_flavor.to_dict.return_value = { 'OS-FLV-WITH-EXT-SPECS:extra_specs': { 'class': 'memory1', }, } mock_image = mock.Mock(status='ACTIVE', min_ram=2) mock_plugin().get_flavor.return_value = mock_flavor mock_plugin().get_image.return_value = mock_image error = self.assertRaises( exception.StackValidationFailed, server.validate) self.assertEqual( 'Flavor 256 MB Server must be booted from volume, ' 'but image CentOS 5.2 was also specified.', six.text_type(error)) def test_validate_image_flavor_excluded_class(self, mock_client, mock_plugin): server = cloud_server.CloudServer("test", self.rsrcdef, self.mockstack) mock_image = mock.Mock(size=1, status='ACTIVE', min_ram=2) mock_image.get.return_value = "!standard1, *" mock_flavor = mock.Mock(ram=4) mock_flavor.to_dict.return_value = { 'OS-FLV-WITH-EXT-SPECS:extra_specs': { 'class': 'standard1', }, } mock_plugin().get_flavor.return_value = mock_flavor mock_plugin().get_image.return_value = mock_image error = self.assertRaises( exception.StackValidationFailed, server.validate) self.assertEqual( 'Flavor 256 MB Server cannot be used with image CentOS 5.2.', six.text_type(error)) def test_validate_image_not_enough_disk(self, mock_client, mock_plugin): server = cloud_server.CloudServer("test", self.rsrcdef, self.mockstack) mock_image = mock.Mock(size=1, status='ACTIVE', min_ram=2, min_disk=2) mock_image.get.return_value = "standard1" mock_flavor = mock.Mock(ram=4, disk=1) mock_flavor.to_dict.return_value = { 'OS-FLV-WITH-EXT-SPECS:extra_specs': { 'class': 'standard1', 'disk_io_index': 1, }, } mock_plugin().get_flavor.return_value = mock_flavor mock_plugin().get_image.return_value = mock_image error = self.assertRaises( exception.StackValidationFailed, server.validate) self.assertEqual( 'Image CentOS 5.2 requires 2 GB minimum disk space. ' 'Flavor 256 MB Server has only 1 GB.', six.text_type(error)) def test_validate_image_size_zero(self, mock_client, mock_plugin): server = cloud_server.CloudServer("test", self.rsrcdef, self.mockstack) mock_image = mock.Mock(size=0, status='ACTIVE', min_ram=2, min_disk=2) mock_image.get.return_value = "standard1" mock_flavor = mock.Mock(ram=4, disk=4) mock_flavor.to_dict.return_value = { 'OS-FLV-WITH-EXT-SPECS:extra_specs': { 'class': 'standard1', 'disk_io_index': 1, }, } mock_plugin().get_flavor.return_value = mock_flavor mock_plugin().get_image.return_value = mock_image error = self.assertRaises( exception.StackValidationFailed, server.validate) self.assertEqual( 'Image CentOS 5.2 has size <= 0', six.text_type(error)) def test_validate_image_flavor_ok(self, mock_client, mock_plugin): server = cloud_server.CloudServer("test", self.rsrcdef, self.mockstack) mock_image = mock.Mock(size=1, status='ACTIVE', min_ram=2, min_disk=2) mock_image.get.return_value = "standard1" mock_flavor = mock.Mock(ram=4, disk=4) mock_flavor.to_dict.return_value = { 'OS-FLV-WITH-EXT-SPECS:extra_specs': { 'class': 'standard1', 'disk_io_index': 1, }, } mock_plugin().get_flavor.return_value = mock_flavor mock_plugin().get_image.return_value = mock_image self.assertIsNone(server.validate())

commit_message:
fix sample config link that 404s

this link 404s:
  http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/_static/keystone.conf.sample

it can be seen on this page:
  http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/sample_config.html

Change-Id: Ide97caf90659e3bb3511fd629e945c275e522151

commit_message:
Filter HA routers without HA interface and state

This patch adjusts the sync method to exclude any HA
routers from the response that are missing necessary
HA fields (the HA interface and the HA state).

This prevents the agent from every receiving a partially
formed router.

Co-Authored-By: Ann Kamyshnikova <akamyshnikova@mirantis.com>

Related-Bug: #1499647
Closes-Bug: #1533441
Change-Id: Iadb5a69d4cbc2515fb112867c525676cadea002b
(cherry picked from commit 046be0b8f30291cd029e6e97a4c6c5a1717a8bd1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/65/286065/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_allocating_router_hidden_from_sync(self): self.plugin.supported_extension_aliases = [ constants.L3_HA_MODE_EXT_ALIAS] # simulate a router that is being allocated during # the agent's synchronization r1, r2 = self._create_router(), self._create_router() self.plugin._delete_ha_interfaces(self.admin_ctx, r1['id']) # store shorter name for readability get_method = self.plugin._get_active_l3_agent_routers_sync_data # r1 should be hidden self.assertEqual([r2['id']], [r['id'] for r in get_method(self.admin_ctx, None, self.agent1, [r1['id'], r2['id']])]) # but once it transitions back, all is well in the world again! rdb = self.plugin._get_router(self.admin_ctx, r1['id']) self.plugin._create_ha_interfaces( self.admin_ctx, rdb, self.plugin.get_ha_network( self.admin_ctx, rdb.tenant_id)) # just compare ids since python3 won't let us sort dicts expected = sorted([r1['id'], r2['id']]) result = sorted([r['id'] for r in get_method( self.admin_ctx, None, self.agent1, [r1['id'], r2['id']])]) self.assertEqual(expected, result)

commit_message:
Add support for DSA signatures

Previously, only RSA-PSS signatures were supported for signature
verification in Glance. This patch adds support for verifying Digital
Signature Algorithm signatures, including unit tests.

Change-Id: I856399b6d28cf078aad2e280829671ffca85f533
Closes-Bug: #1513973
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/37/248237/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric import dsaTEST_DSA_PRIVATE_KEY = dsa.generate_private_key(key_size=3072, backend=default_backend()) def test_verify_signature_DSA(self, mock_get_pub_key): checksum_hash = b'224626ae19824466f2a7f39ab7b80f7f' mock_get_pub_key.return_value = TEST_DSA_PRIVATE_KEY.public_key() for hash_name, hash_alg in signature_utils.HASH_METHODS.items(): signer = TEST_DSA_PRIVATE_KEY.signer( hash_alg ) signer.update(checksum_hash) signature = base64.b64encode(signer.finalize()) image_props = {CERT_UUID: 'fea14bc2-d75f-4ba5-bccc-b5c924ad0693', HASH_METHOD: hash_name, KEY_TYPE: 'DSA', SIGNATURE: signature} self.assertTrue(signature_utils.verify_signature(None, checksum_hash, image_props)) @mock.patch('glance.common.signature_utils.get_public_key') def test_get_public_key_dsa(self, mock_get_cert): fake_cert = FakeCryptoCertificate(TEST_DSA_PRIVATE_KEY.public_key()) mock_get_cert.return_value = fake_cert result_pub_key = signature_utils.get_public_key(None, None, 'DSA') self.assertEqual(fake_cert.public_key(), result_pub_key) @mock.patch('glance.common.signature_utils.get_certificate')

commit_message:
Remove dash for resource-type in cli

For consistent with other openstack cli commands [1], use
`openstack search resource type list` instead of
`openstack search resource-type list`

[1]:

commit_message:
Validate user exist when assigning roles in V2

This validation should not have been removed before to satisfy
the federation use case, because federation performs user to group
assignment and not assigning roles directly to users.

Co-Authored-By: Lin Hua Cheng <os.lcheng@gmail.com>

Change-Id: If7b1225e40524f9b31d0ec11041c4f2766704170
Closes-Bug: #1313956

deleted_lines: def test_user_role_add_no_user(self): # If add_user_role and user doesn't exist, doesn't fail. client.roles.add_user_role(tenant=self.tenant_baz['id'], user=uuid.uuid4().hex, role=self.role_member['id'])

commit_message:
install: Add references to RPM locations.

There are RPMs available for the master branches of networking-ovn and
OVS/OVN.  Add notes about where they can be found.

Change-Id: I9afdc0079202e95a6dc3b0887153da55d5356d49
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/71/287371/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: A ``python-networking-ovn`` RPM may be obtained for Fedora or CentOS from the RDO project. A package based on the ``master`` branch of ``networking-ovn`` can be found at http://trunk.rdoproject.org/. Fedora and CentOS RPM builds of OVS and OVN from the ``master`` branch of ``ovs`` can be found in this COPR repository: https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/pmatilai/dpdk-snapshot/. Note that this repository contains OVS built with DPDK support, but that should have no effect unless you choose to enable the use of DPDK.

commit_message:
Rename tox env to pep8

It turns out the linters rename was a bit premature[1].  Use the
current standard pep8 name so we don't need custom jobs in the
gate to run this test on proposed changes.

Change-Id: I5226d4c5e3d4095d76cba24fcf27f87c59730587
1: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-February/086268.html
(cherry picked from commit 63df8f1a019934402e939cf361acb3e373f2854a)

commit_message:
Fix requirements after python-fuelclient 8.0 released

In stable/7.0 branch, since release of 8.0 version of
python-fuelclient, we need to pin its version to 7.0.

commit_message:
HA for NameNode and ResourceManager in HDP 2.2

The general configs added to enable HA mode for both NameNode and
ResourceManager.

The HA is enabled by adding a set of configs to the Blueprint.

implements bp: hdp-22-support

Change-Id: Ie9336ca4f5bd24856fa2f3017b0cd61ce5145d1d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/51/197551/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from sahara.plugins.ambari import ha_helper p_common.SECONDARY_NAMENODE, p_common.JOURNAL_NODE], general_conf = cluster.cluster_configs["general"] if general_conf.get("NameNode_HA"): ha_helper.validate_namenode_ha(cluster) if general_conf.get("ResourceManager_HA"): ha_helper.validate_resourcemanager_ha(cluster)

commit_message:
Revert "Disable image uplaods to vexxhost"

This reverts commit 20122f086d6383addbf01d6e9bdadcffd2396d02.

Image uploads are reliable now go ahead and use vexxhost. For background
vexxhost made a config change to their web servers in front of glance
which make everything happy again.

Change-Id: Iaffd67eac8b6e1df899e1e6128b6bc4028fc9b93

subject: launchpad bug 1537330, fix _is_active_nic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-13 02:54:12.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-net-config/commit/cb4f56f72cd9a194661762c343c48392d70ba6ce', 'message': 'launchpad bug 1537330, fix _is_active_nic

The detailed bug description is at
https://bugs.launchpad.net/os-net-config/+bug/1537330

Since kilo, os-net-config starts to support linux bond.
However, the addr_assign_type value of an active member
interface of a linux bond is 3, but not 0. The consequence
of this problem is that the linux bond member links are
never considered as active, this further messes up the
nicX to interface name mapping.

This change checks if device directory exists, instead
of checking the addr_assign_type value. This directory
exists only when the interface is an actual physical
interface.

Change-Id: I8e4c95a2efa809fd236b07cbce1b81a2e774f858
'}]
commit_message:
launchpad bug 1537330, fix _is_active_nic

The detailed bug description is at
https://bugs.launchpad.net/os-net-config/+bug/1537330

Since kilo, os-net-config starts to support linux bond.
However, the addr_assign_type value of an active member
interface of a linux bond is 3, but not 0. The consequence
of this problem is that the linux bond member links are
never considered as active, this further messes up the
nicX to interface name mapping.

This change checks if device directory exists, instead
of checking the addr_assign_type value. This directory
exists only when the interface is an actual physical
interface.

Change-Id: I8e4c95a2efa809fd236b07cbce1b81a2e774f858
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-net-config refs/changes/42/279842/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: device_dir = _SYS_CLASS_NET + '/%s/device' % interface_name has_device_dir = os.path.isdir(device_dir) if has_device_dir and carrier == 1 and address:
deleted_lines: addr_assign_type = None with open(_SYS_CLASS_NET + '/%s/addr_assign_type' % interface_name, 'r') as f: addr_assign_type = int(f.read().rstrip()) if addr_assign_type == 0 and carrier == 1 and address:
